alert.note: Alert for Uintah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 30 at 12:45PM MDT until June 04 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Duchesne River near Randlett affecting Uintah County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river and stream flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt will continue. * WHERE...Duchesne River near Randlett. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, minor flooding is expected across low-lying agricultural land along the Duchesne River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue to exceed bankfull conditions, rising to 11.8 feet by Friday afternoon. It will then decline over the weekend, oscillating below critical levels. - Action stage is 11.3 feet. - Flood stage is 13.3 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
